page.title: 15Kent and Curwen
page.content: Kent and Curwen is a worldwide menswear shop and factory. It only makes clothes out of natural fibres for example silk, wool and cotton. The factory employs 40 people. There are three shops in London, one in Paris, three hundred in Japan and some in Switzerland. The 1985 fashion colours are the ice cream and pastels. Kent and Curwen have good quality clothes. In the factory, a jumper can be made in 50 minutes. The staffs working hours are 8.00am-5.00pm. Their buisiest day is Saturday. The age group buy the most clothes are between 30 and 40 years old. A cricket sweater will cost Â£42.00. Kent and Curwen make the England cricket team sweaters in 2 hours.
